greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sequence a_k of column k shifts left k places under Weigh transform and equals signum(n) for n<k; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..200, flattened
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to arXiv version]

M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to Lin. Alg. Applic. version together with omitted figures]
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
add(binomial(T(i, k), j)*b(n-i*j, i-1, k), j=0..n/i)))
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[Binomial[T[i, k], j]*b[n - i*j, i - 1, k], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_, k_] := If[n < k, Sign[n], b[n - k, n - k, k]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 16}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 10 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 23 2018
